poem:
Title: The Iron Hand, Unmasked 

Thick is law's veil, yet thinnest
Under this northern mist.
Speaketh the first minister - assures
In the language of the just.
Yet beneath the spectre of looming words,
Shadows dance, distrust unfurls.
Voices echo, tension swirls,
And freedom, silently, is hurled.
Thus, Scotland, wear your courage bold,
Against the winter, frigid, cold.
